PARAGRAPH.STRING: is the third highest mountain in the Hindu Kush, in the Chitral district of the Northwest Frontier Province of Pakistan.
is the 68th highest independent peak in the world.
crowns a massif with eleven peaks of elevation more than 7,000 m (22,966 ft).
is located a few kilometres northeast of Tirich Mir (the highest mountain in the Hindu Kush), across the Tirich Glacier. Because
is behind the higher peak of Tirich Mir from many viewpoints,
is not easily visible and therefore not well known.
The word "Istoro Nal" means horseshoe in the Khowar language (Istor means "horse"). The origin of the name is unclear.

was first climbed on June 8, 1955 by the Americans Major Ken Bankwala, Joseph E. Murphy, Jr., and Thomas A. Mutch, on a Princeton Mountaineering Club expedition. They climbed the west ridge, starting from the south side of

on the Tirich Glacier. Their small, minimally financed expedition (by the standards of the time for high-altitude mountaineering) achieved what was then the second highest summit attained by Americans.
